message.content:
cs.DC, cs.Distributed, cs.PF, cs.PL, cs.OS

Reasoning: The paper discusses a library for asynchronous non-blocking point-to-point operations in MPI, which is a distributed computing paradigm. Therefore, cs.DC (Distributed Computing) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses performance comparisons and issues related to thread/process placement, which are relevant to cs.PF (Performance) and cs.PL (Programming Languages). The paper also mentions the underlying communication infrastructure, which is relevant to cs.OS (Operating Systems).
